School Update - April 6, 2020

The Idaho State Board of Education met today to discuss whether or not to extend the soft closure (the initial soft closure extended through April 20). The board‚Äôs decision was to extend the soft closure indefinitely until re-opening criteria established by the Idaho State Board of Education have been met.

So what does this mean? Will students return to the classroom this school year, or will they not? The answer to this question looks like it all depends on what happens going forward in regards to the COVID-19 threat. The State Board of Education is going to create a set of criteria that must be met before schools will be allowed to re-open, and that criteria will be shared with us next week. While we are all hoping and planning on the return of our students as soon as possible, we are also preparing for the soft closure to last through the end of this school year (May 28), and we would recommend that parents also prepare themselves for this possibility.

Please visit our website for more information (www.hsbschools.org).

SCHOOL CLOSURES ANNOUNCED

The Idaho State Board of Education just announced that Idaho's schools are to close through April 20. It is a "soft closure", meaning there will be no students on campus, but education will continue from Monday, March 30 (end of our spring break) through Monday, April 20. This is not merely a recommendation, but is a directive that we are obligated as a public school to follow. We hoped and prayed it would not come to this, but we have prepared for it. We will be sharing with you soon the details of how we are going to move forward, so please pay close attention to your email and our Facebook page. This is going to be a challenging few weeks for everyone, but we will get through it, and we stand at the ready to assist you in any way we can. Again, more details coming soon on our plan to continue educating our students.

School Update ‚Äì March 18, 2020 / 3:30pm

A reminder that classes have been cancelled for Thursday, March 19, 2020. Teachers and staff will be on campus, so please don‚Äôt hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns.

We fully intend to keep to our original 2019-20 school calendar, and short of a directive from our state leaders, we will be back at school with all of our students on Monday, March 30.

That plan will include a time and location to pick up textbooks, computers, missing assignments, etc... for those students out this week. Middle and high school students who were in attendance today, and whose parents indicated on the survey that they needed a computer, had a computer checked out to them today and will be bringing it home with them.

Have a great spring break.

Please congratulate these girls on their commitment if you get a chance. Kudos also go out to Jeff Longacre for stepping up to coach when no one else was willing, and his efforts to keep the program alive.
